segment.source: Deploy Windows using Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Deploy Windows using Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Deploy Windows using Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Deploy Windows using Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Deploy Windows using Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Deploy Windows using Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: There are three ways to set up jobs and associated assets.
segment.target: There are three ways to set up jobs and associated assets.

segment.source: You can set up a job to perform the following:
segment.target: You can set up a job to perform the following:

segment.source: Assess computers that already have a supported, running operating system.
segment.target: Assess computers that already have a supported, running operating system.

segment.source: Deploy a supported operating system to a computer by using Windows Assessment Services, and then assess the computer.
segment.target: Deploy a supported operating system to a computer by using Windows Assessment Services, and then assess the computer.

segment.source: Use other deployment tools or methods to deploy a supported operating system to a computer, and then assess the computer.
segment.target: Use other deployment tools or methods to deploy a supported operating system to a computer, and then assess the computer.

segment.source: This topic describes all three of these deployment options.
segment.target: This topic describes all three of these deployment options.

segment.source: To add assets to a job and deploy an image
segment.target: To add assets to a job and deploy an image

segment.source: In the Windows ASC, create or open a job.
segment.target: In the Windows ASC, create or open a job.

segment.source: Under Job settings, click Overview, and verify that the Apply image check box is selected.
segment.target: Under Job settings, click Overview, and verify that the Apply image check box is selected.

segment.source: If you want to inject matching Plug and Play drivers from a Dynamic Driver Provisioning driver store during image deployment, select Dynamic Driver Provisioning.
segment.target: If you want to inject matching Plug and Play drivers from a Dynamic Driver Provisioning driver store during image deployment, select Dynamic Driver Provisioning.

segment.source: Under Job settings, click Assets, and then click Add to select the computers that you want run the job on.
segment.target: Under Job settings, click Assets, and then click Add to select the computers that you want run the job on.

segment.source: In the Select Evaluation Assets window, select the computers that you want to assess, click Next, and then click Finish.
segment.target: In the Select Evaluation Assets window, select the computers that you want to assess, click Next, and then click Finish.

segment.source: The computers appear on the right side of the Windows ASC under Evaluation assets.
segment.target: The computers appear on the right side of the Windows ASC under Evaluation assets.

segment.source: Select a computer, click Change Image, select the image that you want to apply to that computer, and then click OK.
segment.target: Select a computer, click Change Image, select the image that you want to apply to that computer, and then click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The computer and the image architecture must match, except that you can select an x86-based image to deploy to an x64-based computer.
segment.target: The computer and the image architecture must match, except that you can select an x86-based image to deploy to an x64-based computer.

segment.source: To add assets to a job and use custom deployment
segment.target: To add assets to a job and use custom deployment

segment.source: In the Windows ASC, create or open a job.
segment.target: In the Windows ASC, create or open a job.

segment.source: Under Job settings, click Overview, and verify that the Apply image check box is selected.
segment.target: Under Job settings, click Overview, and verify that the Apply image check box is selected.

segment.source: Clear the Dynamic Driver Provisioning check box.
segment.target: Clear the Dynamic Driver Provisioning check box.

segment.source: Under Job settings, click Assets, and then click Add to select the computers that you want run the job on.
segment.target: Under Job settings, click Assets, and then click Add to select the computers that you want run the job on.

segment.source: In the Select Evaluation Assets window, select the computers that you want to assess, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Select Evaluation Assets window, select the computers that you want to assess, and then click Next.

segment.source: Click Use Predeployed Image, and then click Finish.
segment.target: Click Use Predeployed Image, and then click Finish.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you schedule a job by using Use Predeployed Image, the job does not start until you deploy Windows and run %WASServer%relaxscriptstestmachinecompletedeployment.cmd AUTO at an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: When you schedule a job by using Use Predeployed Image, the job does not start until you deploy Windows and run %WASServer%relaxscriptstestmachinecompletedeployment.cmd AUTO at an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: To add assets to a job without deploying an image
segment.target: To add assets to a job without deploying an image

segment.source: In the Windows ASC, create or open a job.
segment.target: In the Windows ASC, create or open a job.

segment.source: Under Job settings, click Overview, and then clear the Apply image check box.
segment.target: Under Job settings, click Overview, and then clear the Apply image check box.

segment.source: Under Job settings, click Assets, and then click Add to select the computers that you want run the job on.
segment.target: Under Job settings, click Assets, and then click Add to select the computers that you want run the job on.

segment.source: In the Select Evaluation Assets window, select the computers that you want to assess, and then click Finish.
segment.target: In the Select Evaluation Assets window, select the computers that you want to assess, and then click Finish.
